statement.p: Find the slope of the line between the points (2, 8) and (-2, 12)
The slope is .

solution.p: The slope is \dfrac{12 - 8}{-2-2} = \dfrac{4}{-4} = {-1}

statement.p: Determine if the functions below are inverses of each other.

Answer:
yes
no

solution.p: We evaluate f(g(x)) and check if the result is x\text{:}
Since f(g(x))=x\text{,} we can say that yes, f(x) and g(x) are inverses of each other.

statement.p: Determine if the table below could represent a linear or exponential function. Then find a formula for the function the table describes.

The table describes a(n)
?
Linear
Exponential
function with formula

solution.p: There is not a constant difference between function values, so we try multplication instead. After computing {7}/5=1.4\text{,} we check that it is the consistent multiple between function values:
So we conclude that this table could represent an exponential function. The initial value is f(0)=5 and we found b=1.4\text{,} so f(x)={5\cdot 1.4^{x}}\text{.}

statement.p: Determine if the table below could represent a linear or exponential function. Then find a formula for the function the table describes.

The table describes a(n)
?
Linear
Exponential
function with formula

solution.p: We observe that there is a constant difference between the function values of 5\text{:}
That means this table could represent a linear function. To find the formula, we note that the slope is 5 and the vertical intercept is f(0)=8\text{,} so the formula is f(x)={8+5x}\text{.}

statement.p: Find the formula of a linear function whose graph passes through the points (-4, {-7}) and (3, {7})\text{.}

solution.p: We first find the slope m\text{:}

Now that we have the slope, we know the linear function has formula f(x) = b + 2 x, where b is the vertical intercept. To find the value of b\text{,} we can plug in either point. Well plug in the first point:
So the formula is f(x)={1+2x}\text{.}

statement.p: Find the formula of an exponential function whose graph passes through the points (1, {7.2}) and (4, {1.5552})\text{.}

solution.p: Since we are trying to find an exponential function, we start with the formula f(x)=a(b)^x. We find b using the ratio \dfrac{f(4)}{f(1)}\text{:}
Now we know that f(x) = a (0.6)^{x}\text{.} To find the value of a\text{,} we plug the first point into the formula and solve for a\text{:}
So the exponential function is f(x)={12\cdot 0.6^{x}}\text{.}

statement.p: Suppose we want to examine the effects of a new drug on anxiety. We run an experiment using two groups: a placebo group, and an experimental group. Choose the appropriate test.

solution.p: The study involves two independent samples, so the 2-Sample T-Test is the appropriate test.

statement.p: Suppose we want to see if an exam prep program will affect students’ performance on the Calculus I gateway exam (a test that students can take multiple times until they pass it). We obtain a random sample of Calculus I students and record their scores on the gateway exam before and after they participate in the exam prep program. Choose the appropriate test.

solution.p: The study involves two dependent samples with matched data - before and after results for individuals were recorded. This means the Paired T-Test is the appropriate test to use.

statement.p: Suppose we want to examine the effects of three different techniques of reducing anxiety about getting vaccinations on toddlers. We run an experiment using three groups. Each group is randomly assigned to one of the three different techniques. Choose the appropriate test.

solution.p: The study compares three or more means and all samples are independent of each other, so One-Way ANOVA is the appropriate test.

statement.p: A study was conducted to investigate the effectiveness of hypnotism in reducing pain. A randomly selected group of subjects are measured for pain before and after hypnosis. Choose the appropriate test.

solution.p: The study involves two dependent samples with matched data. Before and after results for individuals were recorded. This means the Paired T-Test is the appropriate test to use.

statement.p: Find the slope of the line between the points (12, 5) and (13, 5)
The slope is .

solution.p: The slope is \dfrac{5 - 5}{13-12} = \dfrac{0}{1} = {0}
